title: Sasso Sponsors Leadership Awards
text:
21 September 2015 17:39 CET Sasso Sponsors Leadership Awards By Daily Guide Mr. Samson Effah Apraku, Executive Chairman of Sasso, presenting a copy of the MoU to Mr. Daniel Tuffour of ExLA Group. 
Samara Company Limited, producers of Sasso insecticide spray and coil, has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with ExLA Group to sponsor the 2015 edition of the Excellent Leadership Awards (ExLA Awards). 
Samara Company Limited would be the main sponsor of the awards scheme. 
The ExLA award scheme, which was instituted in 2011, seeks to among others, reward and empower individuals and organizations that have excelled in the various fields of endeavour in Ghana. 
A number of dignitaries, including former President John Agyekum Kufour, former First Lady Nana Konadu Agyeman Rawlings, Nana Akufo-Addo, presidential candidate of the New Patriotic Party (NPP) and Very Rev. Father Andrew Campbell, Executive Member of the Leprosy Aid Committee have been honoured by ExLA. 
Other recipients are Patrick Awuah, President of Ashesi University, Joseph Siaw Agyepong of the Jospong Group of Companies, Osei Kwame Despite, owner of the Despite Group of Companies, Kwaku Sintim Misa (KSM), a television personality, Shamima Muslim and Manasseh Azure. 
Daniel Osei Tuffour, Executive Director of ExLA Group, said the winners of the awards, who are selected from areas such as politics, sports and others disciplines, have made contributions to improve society. 
He was happy the management of Sasso had accepted to be the lead sponsor of the awards scheme. 
Mr. Tuffour expressed the hope that the signing of the MoU would help boost the image of the Sasso brand and ExLA Group. 
The Executive Chairman of Samara Company Limited, Samson Effah Apraku, indicated that his outfit is privileged to promote an honourable cause which seeks to boost the growth and development in the society. 
He added that 'an excellent cause of this nature will be supported to enhance the development and growth of our society.' 
An executive of the awards scheme told BUISINESS GUIDE that nominations for the awards would be opened on Tuesday, September 8 while the event would be held in October 2015. 
By Solomon Ofori
